criteria: Understanding of Diverse Media and Formats
descriptions: The student fails to identify any main ideas in the media or format presented.
The student struggles to identify main ideas, offering vague or inaccurate interpretations.
The student identifies some main ideas, but the selection is incomplete or partially inaccurate.
The student correctly identifies most main ideas presented in the media or format.
The student accurately identifies the main ideas in the media or format, demonstrating a clear understanding.
The student expertly identifies and articulates the main ideas, demonstrating a comprehensive grasp of the content.
The student does not identify any supporting details or provides irrelevant information.
The student struggles to identify relevant supporting details, offering vague or inaccurate examples.
The student identifies some supporting details, but the selection is incomplete or connection to main idea is unclear.
The student correctly identifies most supporting details and relates them to the main ideas.
The student accurately identifies and analyzes the supporting details, explaining their relevance to the main ideas.
The student expertly analyzes supporting details, demonstrating a sophisticated understanding of how they reinforce main ideas and clarify the topic.
The student fails to explain how the ideas clarify the topic, text, or issue.
The student attempts to explain clarification, but the explanation is unclear or lacks logical reasoning.
The student provides a basic explanation of how the ideas clarify the topic, text, or issue, but it is superficial.
The student explains how the ideas clarify the topic, text, or issue with reasonable clarity and coherence.
The student clearly and thoroughly explains how the ideas clarify the topic, text, or issue, demonstrating a solid understanding.
The student expertly explains how the ideas clarify the topic, text, or issue, offering insightful connections and nuanced interpretations.
The student shows no understanding of the media or format presented.
The student shows limited understanding of the media or format, struggling to interpret its content.
The student demonstrates some understanding of the media or format, but the interpretation is basic.
The student understands the media or format and can interpret its content with reasonable accuracy.
The student demonstrates a strong understanding of the media or format, interpreting its content accurately and thoughtfully.
The student expertly understands and interprets the media or format, offering insightful analysis of its effectiveness and impact.
